author: agemanning
content:
Not yet sorry. 
It is in our to-do list however. I wonder if we want 5.1 for eth2 mainnet?

author: nishant0
content: I havent really looked into it yet on my end,

author: pipermerriam
content: no, the wire protocol changed, but the overal application logic stays largely the same.  It's not a massive update and it isn't a small update.

author: pipermerriam
content: But the protocol is extensible which is really powerful and I think it would be worth it because it opens up options for all kinds of other utilities to be built on top of it.

author: pipermerriam
content: the spec in that document isn't 100% accurate, but the concept holds.  And the wire protocol still has the same behavior as v5, just changes to the 3 different message formats.

author: djrtwo
content: at this point, we'd need to consider an upgrade path (e.g. 5.1 falling back to 5.0 if the peer doesn't speak 5.1), right?

author: djrtwo
content: at least if we rolled it out on, say, medalla

author: pipermerriam
content: one nice bonus in v5.1 is that it allows sharing the port with other protocols running on the same port (differentiation happening at the datagram level)
